newsitem.title: ITALY: Rinascente says Auchan strategic ally.
newsitem.headline: Rinascente says Auchan strategic ally.

text.p: Italian retailer Rinascente's future is based on its "marriage" with France's Auchan, but the group has a three-year 1.3 trillion lire investment plan and thanks to the management "savoir faire" of its French partner it aims to recoup margins and efficiency, its MD said.
Managing Director Giovanni Cobolli Gigli told the annual shareholders' meeting: "Auchan will give us one trillion lire of extra turnover and with this a margin improvement up to two percent."
Italy's largest quoted retail group and French privately-owned Auchan agreed last month to pool their Italian operations to form a new powerful force in Italian retailing.
Rinascente forecasts investing at least the level of cash flow, or some 350 billion lire, per year.
Cobolli said that in the retailing sector "it's difficult to play with prices because it is necessary to remain competitive, but there's a lot to shave off in the area of producer companies.
"With Auchan we have ambitious goals and first of all we will create an international buying centre," he said.
The agreement with the French company did not for the moment include the do-it-yourself division but Cobolli said a future accord in this sector was "possible." -- Milan newsroom +392 66129589
